content.question: A cylindrical rod is attached to a disk, as shown. The mass of the rod is equal to the mass of the disk and both the rod and disk have uniform density. The rod-disk system rotates about the dashed axis shown, which goes through the center of mass of the system. Which of the following claims about the rotational inertia of the system is true?

choices.label: The rod and the disk both contribute the same amount to the system’s rotational inertia.
The rod contributes more to the system’s rotational inertia than the disk.
The disk contributes more to the system’s rotational inertia than the rod.
The faster the system spins, the more the disk contributes to the system’s rotational inertia.

content.answer: The disk contributes more to the system’s rotational inertia than the rod.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
